provider.description: Provider to be used to connect to the router

remote_as.description: Remote AS for the neighbor to be added
remote_as.usage: Then name of the remote AS for which neighbor is to be added.

password_encrypted.description: Password in the input is encrypted or plain text
password_encrypted.usage: Specify whether the password is encrypted.

password_string.usage: Set a password for enabling authentication between the two neighbors. It can be a plain string or encrypted.

update_source.description: Update source interface to be added
update_source.usage: The interface specified in this parameter is used for establishing TCP connection.

address_family.description: Address Family to be added in neighbor
address_family.usage: Specify the address family. Available options are "ipv4", "ipv6", "vpnv4" and "vpnv6".

unicast_routepolicy.description: list of Route Policy to be added in the Neighbor. A map of name and direction of route policy

name.description: Name of the route Policy to be added in the Neighbor

direction.description: Direction of the route Policy to be added in the Neighbor

unicast_routepolicy.usage: The route policies specified in this parameter is added under the bgp neighbor.

bgp_id.description: BGP instance under which neighbor has to be added
bgp_id.usage: BGP neighbor will be added to the bgp instance specified using this parameter.

neighbor_id.description: Neighbor ID for the new neighbor to be created
neighbor_id.usage: The IP address of the neighbor which is being added.

use_neighbor_group.description: Neighbor group for the new neighbor to be created
use_neighbor_group.usage: The neighbor will be part of the peer group name specified in this param.

collection_type.description: Collection type to be used for data collection

description.description: Description for the new neighbor to be created
description.usage: Description of the neighbor to be added.

vrf.description: Vrf name under which new neighbor is to be created
vrf.usage: Name of vrf under which neighbor is to be added. If the vrf is not given then the neighbor is added under BGP

mop_timeout.description: Timeout duration for MoP i.e. maximum time spent in Running/Paused states. e.g. 900s, 10m, 1.5h, etc. Valid time units are 'ns', 'us' (or 'Âµs'), 'ms', 's', 'm', 'h'.
